item.title: Ambiga lauds police, organisers for peaceful anti-Icerd rally - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Malaysiakini

Activist and seasoned rally attendee Ambiga Sreenevasan has lauded the organisers of today’s anti-Icerd rally, as well as the police, for ensuring a peaceful event. "I congratulate the organisers and police for a peaceful rally. Welcome to New Malaysia," she said on Twitter. Lawyer N Surendran, meanwhile, lauded media coverage of the event. "Nice to see live coverage of an oppositon rally on TV. This is truly Malaysia Baru. "Umno-BN please hang your head in shame! You never allowed coverage and demonised rallies," he tweeted. Tens of thousands had flocked to downtown Kuala Lumpur today to c...

item.title: Dr M thanks one million people for turning up at anti-ICERD rally - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Dr M thanks one million people for turning up at anti-ICERD rally  Malaysia Today

(MMO) – Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today appeared unconcern with the mammoth anti-ICERD ‘thanksgiving’ rally, sarcastically thanking the one million people who turned up at the event. “We know that the gathering today was attended by one million people, and I thank them because they gathered for thanksgiving. One million people. Thank you,” he told a press conference here after the Pakatan Harapan (PH) Presidential Council meeting. He also gave himself a pat on the back, over his recent decision to not ratify the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial...

item.title: ICERD has been turned into Malay versus Chinese - Malaysia Today
item.description:
ICERD has been turned into Malay versus Chinese  Malaysia Today

Today’s rally and the Chinese response to the rally is evidence that the Malay-Chinese racial divide is permanent and can never be repaired. In fact, the Malays and Chinese no longer filter or control their comments like in the past. Both sides of the divide are now very open and vocal about their hatred for each other. NO HOLDS BARRED Raja Petra Kamarudin Judging by the comments in the social media, WhatsApp groups, WeeChat groups, etc., it looks like the anti-ICERD rally today has been turned into a Malay versus Chinese affair. The Chinese comments show they are clearly opposed to today’s...

item.title: Najib attending anti-Icerd rally from Dang Wangi station? - The Star Online
item.description:
Najib attending anti-Icerd rally from Dang Wangi station?  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Police Federal Reserve Units (FRU) and police personnel are on standby in front of the Dang Wangi police district headquarters here. There are rumours that former premier Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak could be departing for the anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) rally from the police station. A team of police officers has also opened up a table by the sidewalk where they are enjoying a light meal. Lined up in front of the station are an FRU water cannon truck, five other red FRU trucks and seven dark blue police trucks w...

item.title: Dr M: I can’t attend Suhakam event tomorrow - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Dr M: I can’t attend Suhakam event tomorrow  Malaysia Today

“I decided that we will not accept ICERD. Suhakam wants to accept ICERD. So, how can I go?” (FMT) – Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad has questioned how he will be able to attend a pro-human rights celebration tomorrow now that the government has taken an about-turn in ratifying ICERD. “I decided that we will not accept ICERD (the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination). “Suhakam (the Malaysian Human Rights Commission) wants to accept ICERD. “So, how can I go?” asked the Pakatan Harapan (PH) chairman after chairing the PH Presidential Council meet...

item.title: Malaysia: Malays rally amid worries over government 'weakness' - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
Malaysia: Malays rally amid worries over government 'weakness'  Al Jazeera English

Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia - Tens of thousands of ethnic Malays have taken to the streets of Malaysia's capital to "celebrate" a government decision not to ratify a key UN anti-discrimination treaty, amid growing concerns the seven-month administration of Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad is losing reform momentum. Malaysia is one of only 14 countries in the world that have yet to sign the International Convention on the Elimination of all forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD). The treaty what constitutes racial discrimination and sets forth a series of principles and guidelines by which states ...

item.title: Crowd builds up at Dataran Merdeka, ahead of 2pm anti-Icerd rally - The Star Online
item.description:
Crowd builds up at Dataran Merdeka, ahead of 2pm anti-Icerd rally  The Star Online

A crowd is building up at Dataran Merdeka as of 11.30am on Saturday (Dec 8). Anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) rally participants, mostly clad in white T-shirts with the 'anti-Icerd' printed in front, were seen bustling to Jalan Raja as police have blocked the adjacent roads along Jalan Hishammuddin and Jalan Tun Perak to motorists.

item.title: Powerful signals expected from both rallies - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Powerful signals expected from both rallies  Malaysia Today

In a sense, the anti-Icerd rally is a personal challenge to his leadership as the top Malay and Muslim leader. Joceline Tan, The Star THE line in the sand will be more clearly drawn than ever after tomorrow, with the predominantly Malay political opposition on one side and a more mixed ruling coalition on the other. The anti-Icerd rally engineered by PAS and Umno has all the signs of being the biggest Malay-Muslim street protest the country has ever seen in recent times. Parallels are being drawn to the mammoth Islamist rally in Jakarta last weekend that turned the biggest intersection in t...

item.title: Scenes from various locations for anti-ICERD rally - The Star Online
item.description:
Scenes from various locations for anti-ICERD rally  The Star Online

Here are the afternoon scenes of the controversial anti-ICERD rally in Kuala Lumpur. Thousands are expected to converge at Dataran Merdeka to "celebrate" the Government's decision to not ratify the ICERD.

item.title: Rallygoers pass out during anti-ICERD rally - The Star Online
item.description:
Rallygoers pass out during anti-ICERD rally  The Star Online

Amal Relief Malaysia personnel were spotted carrying a woman out of the crowded roads in Kuala Lumpur during the anti-ICERD rally on Saturday. Several others also experienced dizziness.

item.title: Suhakam moves Human Rights Day celebration to Sunday (Dec 9) - The Star Online
item.description:
Suhakam moves Human Rights Day celebration to Sunday (Dec 9)  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam) will move its Human Rights Day celebration to Sunday (Dec 9). It tweeted on Friday (Dec 7): "Suhakam’s #HumanRightsDay celebration will now be held on 9 December 2018. Join us in #StandingUpForHumanRights." Earlier, Suhakam said it will be postponing their Human Rights Day celebration on Saturday (Dec 8). Suhakam chairman Tan Sri Razali Ismail said it is with "deep regret and disappointment" that the celebration will be postponed to a later date. He said that the police had informed them and the Prime Minister's Office, without...

item.title: Dr M will not attend Suhakam’s Human Rights Day celebration on Sunday - The Star Online
item.description:
Dr M will not attend Suhakam’s Human Rights Day celebration on Sunday  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad will not be attending the Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam)’s Human Rights Day celebration on Sunday (Dec 9). Dr Mahathir explained that this was because the government had already decided against ratifying the International Convention on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination (Icerd), which was in contrary towards Suhakam’s stand on the contentious issue. “I decided that we will not accept Icerd. Suhakam wants to accept Icerd. So, how can I go,” he said. Dr Mahathir said this after chairing Pakatan Harapan’s presidential c...

item.title: If we can ratify ICERD then why not recognise Israel as well? - Malaysia Today
item.description:
If we can ratify ICERD then why not recognise Israel as well?  Malaysia Today

If Shazwan is really sincere and serious about wanting ICERD, then he should also mention that ‘equality’ and ‘rights’ must also include the rights of Christians to preach Christianity to Muslims and for Muslims to leave Islam to become Christians (just like Muslims have the right to preach Islam to the Christians and for Christians to leave Christianity to become Muslims). Why is Shazwan not also propagating this if he wants ICERD? NO HOLDS BARRED Raja Petra Kamarudin In his article ‘Dear PAS and Umno, here’s something for you to rally about!’ Shazwan Mustafa Kamal, the Assistant News Edit...

item.title: Two big rallies set on same day - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Two big rallies set on same day  Malaysia Today

(The Star) – This weekend, two major gatherings will take place in the Klang Valley, with both sides rallying to uphold human rights in their own context. As the anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) protesters gather in downtown Kuala Lumpur at Dataran Merdeka to celebrate the non-ratification of the United Nations covenant, in Padang Timur, Petaling Jaya, Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad will be the chief guest in a celebration of universal human rights. The event in Petaling Jaya, which the organisers contend was planned thre...

item.title: Dear PAS and Umno, here’s something for you to rally about! - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Dear PAS and Umno, here’s something for you to rally about!  Malaysia Today

They can then snap a few pictures for Facebook and Instagram just to say “Hey, look at the support we have. We’re not irrelevant! Malays are united! Don’t challenge us!” (MMO) – So despite everything that’s happened in the past few weeks, PAS and Umno appear to be adamant about going ahead with the rally against the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD) tomorrow. Supporters have been mobilised from all states in the country, they say. T-shirts and colourful banners and slogans have been printed. The anger is real and cannot be contained, a...

item.title: Pakatan leaders face rally dilemma - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Pakatan leaders face rally dilemma  Malaysia Today

(The Star) – Pakatan Hara­p­an leaders seem to be in a quandary as to whether disciplinary action should be taken against party members who attend tomorrow’s anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) rally organised by Umno and PAS. So far, no Pakatan party has issued a ban on members attending the anti-Icerd rally. PKR vice-president Zuraida Kamaruddin, however, said action should be taken against PKR members who attend the anti-Icerd rally as the party itself had said it is against the rally. Parti Amanah Nasional (Amanah) president Moh...

item.title: DAP using Mahathir to organise pro-ICERD rally - Malaysia Today
item.description:
DAP using Mahathir to organise pro-ICERD rally  Malaysia Today

“Muslims who plan to support Mahathir’s pro-human rights rally this Saturday will end up supporting ICERD. They need to understand, that the western concept of human rights isn’t recognised by the Islamic Syariat. Attend the rally, and you’ll end up supporting the right for non-Malays to enjoy the exact same privileges the Malays do. Worse, the western concept of human rights involves the need for one to accept homosexuality as a way of life and sodomy as an act condoned by law. Basically, if you’re Muslim and attending Mahathir’s rally, the DAP will call you a hypocrite for objecting ICERD...

item.title: Suhakam postpones Human Rights Day celebration on Saturday (Dec 8) - The Star Online
item.description:
Suhakam postpones Human Rights Day celebration on Saturday (Dec 8)  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam) will be postponing their Human Rights Day celebration on Saturday (Dec 8). A source from the Commission confirmed this, but did not want to elaborate further. A press conference on this matter has been scheduled by the Commission at 4pm on Friday (Dec 7). Suhakam chairman Tan Sri Razali Ismail had said that the decision to hold the Human Rights Day celebration on Saturday (Dec 8) at Padang Timur was decided back in October. He said the date for the celebration was decided on Oct 18, in accordance with a date provided by the Pri...

item.title: Speaker rejects Anwar's motion to discuss Icerd in Parliament - The Star Online
item.description:
Speaker rejects Anwar's motion to discuss Icerd in Parliament  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Dewan Rakyat speaker Datuk Mohamad Ariff Md Yusof (pic) rejected a motion by Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim to discuss the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (Icerd) in Parliament on Thursday (Dec 6). Anwar (PH-Port Dickson) asked Mohammad Ariff to allow the motion as lawmakers from across the political divide had supported the Cabinet's recent decision not to ratify Icerd. However, Mohamad Ariff rejected the motion under Parliament Standing Order 18(1). Anwar said that there had been misinterpretation over Icerd, which had led to confu...

item.title: Anwar says no to organiser's anti-ICERD rally invite, government stance strong enough - The Star Online
item.description:
Anwar says no to organiser's anti-ICERD rally invite, government stance strong enough  The Star Online

PKR president and Port Dickson MP Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has snubbed an invitation by the organisers to attend the anti-ICERD rally on Dec 8. He said he would bring up a motion in Parliament to support the government’s decision to not ratify the United Nations’ convention ICERD (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination). Read more at: https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2018/12/06/anwar-no-to-organiser-anti-icerd-rally-invite

item.title: Dr M to launch pro-ICERD rally on same day as anti-ICERD rally - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Dr M to launch pro-ICERD rally on same day as anti-ICERD rally  Malaysia Today

(The Star) – Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad will be launching a pro-human rights rally on the same day as the anti-Icerd rally on Saturday (Dec 8). The Human Rights Commission (Suhakam) is holding its first pro-human rights rally themed “Stand Up 4 Human Rights” in conjunction with International Human Rights Day that falls on Monday (Dec 10). The rally will be held from 9am to 3pm at Padang Timur in Petaling Jaya, while the rally against the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (Icerd) will be held about 10km away at Dataran Merdeka, Kual...

item.title: PM to launch Suhakam's human rights rally on same day as anti-Icerd rally - The Star Online
item.description:
PM to launch Suhakam's human rights rally on same day as anti-Icerd rally  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad will be launching a pro-human rights rally on the same day as the anti-Icerd rally. The two opposing rallies are scheduled for Saturday (Dec 8), with the Human Rights Commission (Suhakam) is holding its first pro-human rights rally themed "Stand Up 4 Human Rights". The rally will be held from 9am to 3pm at Padang Timur in Petaling Jaya, while the rally against the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (Icerd) will be held about 10km away at Dataran Merdeka, Kuala Lumpur. Dr Mahathir is also sch...

item.title: Make rally more meaningful - The Star Online
item.description:
Make rally more meaningful  The Star Online

FOR many years, I have been learning to understand the teachings of Islam through sermons aired by One FM, a Mandarin language unit within RTM. A lady preacher who is a Chinese Muslim convert regularly gives talks on the significance of Islamic celebrations, moral values and matters pertaining to the correct ways of interacting with family members, neighbours, friends, peers and members of the public, quoting beautiful and inspirational verses from the Quran. Although I am a Buddhist, understanding Islam helps to make me a better person. When Tok Guru Datuk Haji Nik Abdul Aziz Nik Mat was m...

item.title: Groups: Issue resolved so call off rally - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Groups: Issue resolved so call off rally  Malaysia Today

“Maybe they want to protect their image because they started it (the protest). But when the government made the decision not to ratify it, they have lost the cause” (The Star) – Calls have grown louder for Saturday’s anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) rally to be cancelled. Although the Kuala Lumpur City Hall and the police have given the organisers the green light for the rally to proceed, moderate activists, as well as two mufti, felt it was still not too late for the gathering to be called off. Moderation advocate Mohamed Tawfik...

item.title: DAP and its excuses for failing the ratification of Icerd - Malaysia Today
item.description:
DAP and its excuses for failing the ratification of Icerd  Malaysia Today

Alex Fong, Malaysiakini Do you remember the days when DAP still boasted about its sacred duty championing for a “Malaysian Malaysia”? I know I do, and I bet everyone else, except DAP leaders, does as well. After all, six months ago, one of their key election promises was to promote equality among Malaysians. Funny how I find myself having to remind them of their “sacred duty” now. When the opportunity presented itself to DAP to perform their “sacred duty” in the form of Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination), DAP secretary-general cum Finan...

item.title: Putrajaya scheming to sign ICERD in another way, PAS claims - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Putrajaya scheming to sign ICERD in another way, PAS claims  Malaysia Today

(MMO) – PAS leader Nasrudin Hassan alleged today Putrajaya could implement the International Convention on Elimination of Racial Discrimination (ICERD) via other means even if it does not ratify the treaty. The PAS information chief told a gathering of Muslim fundamentalist groups here the government may still adopt liberal policies by ratifying other international human rights-based conventions, which he labelled as anti-Islam. He claimed this is possible if it ratifies six other international conventions, including the Convention Against Torture or the Declaration on the Intolerance and t...

item.title: KJ: Saifuddin should step down as minister over ICERD blunder - The Star Online
item.description:
KJ: Saifuddin should step down as minister over ICERD blunder  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Former Youth and Sports minister Khairy Jamaluddin has called on Foreign Affairs Minister Datuk Saifuddin Abdullah to resign over the government's failure to ratify the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD). In a series of tweets Friday (Nov 23), Khairy said that Saifuddin, as the minister, should take responsibility over the matter, as it was not a small blunder. "As expected (Saifuddin and Wisma Putra) caused this major blunder by not thinking this through and convincing (Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad) to make t...

item.title: Putrajaya says no to ICERD - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Putrajaya says no to ICERD  Malaysia Today

(FMT) – Putrajaya today said it would not ratify the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD), amid intense opposition from Malay groups and political parties who warned that the global treaty was a threat to Malaysia’s affirmative action policy. “The government will continue to defend the Federal Constitution which includes the social contract agreed upon by representatives of all races during the founding of this nation,” said a statement from the Prime Minister’s Office. The debate over the ICERD followed a speech by Prime Minister Dr Maha...

item.title: Nazri not taking part in anti-ICERD rally, says happy with govt decision - The Star Online
item.description:
Nazri not taking part in anti-ICERD rally, says happy with govt decision  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Barisan Nasional secretary-general Datuk Seri Nazri Aziz is sitting out the anti-ICERD rally as he is satisfied with the government's decision to not ratify the anti-racial discrimination convention. “I won’t attend. I’m very focused on what I want from the government – that is, for them to retract the decision to ratify it, and they've done that. I’m satisfied. “If we can’t believe the Prime Minister then who can we believe?” he told reporters at the Parliament lobby here on Tuesday (Dec 4). Saying that the ICERD is “no longer an issue”, Umno’s Padang Rengas MP stressed that ...

item.title: Govt not ratifying ICERD - The Star Online
item.description:
Govt not ratifying ICERD  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The government has decided not to ratify the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD) amid rising protests by opponents who claimed that the United Nations human rights agreement would jeopardise the special rights of Malays and bumiputra in the country. With this, the organiser of an anti-ICERD rally in Kuala Lumpur’s Dataran Merdeka on Dec 8, which Umno and PAS planned to join, will go ahead with the gathering to celebrate their victory. Yesterday, the Prime Minister’s Office announced the decision in a brief statement. “The ...

item.title: Najib: BN govt confirmed ICERD went against the Federal Constitution - The Star Online
item.description:
Najib: BN govt confirmed ICERD went against the Federal Constitution  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Concentrate on the waning economy, rather than the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD) which is against the Federal Constitution and the social contract of the nation, says former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak. He said that the previous Barisan Nasional government twice studied ICERD in 2011 and 2015, but dropped the idea of ratifying it because the convention was found to be incompatible with the Federal Constitution. "Under the BN government, a committee known as ICERD Technical Committee was formed by the Unity ...

item.title: Anti-ICERD rally on Dec 8 to go on, but this time to celebrate - The Star Online
item.description:
Anti-ICERD rally on Dec 8 to go on, but this time to celebrate  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The organiser of a Dec 8 mass rally in Kuala Lumpur to protest the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD) has claimed victory following the government's decision not to ratify it. Aminuddin Yahaya, secretariat chief of the Malay-Muslim NGO Ummah, said the Dec 8 rally would continue as planned, but this time as a celebration. “It will go ahead, to celebrate the victory of the rakyat's move to pressure the government into rejecting ICERD,” Aminuddin said on Friday. Ummah, together with another group Sekretariat Kedaulatan Negar...

item.title: Two DAP reps say being probed by cops over ICERD promotion - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Two DAP reps say being probed by cops over ICERD promotion  Malaysia Today

(MMO) – Two DAP assemblymen from Tanah Rata and Tras were investigated by police today after nine police reports were lodged against them for promoting the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination. (ICERD) Chow Yu Hui, the assemblyman for Tras and Chiong Yoke Kong, the assemblyman from Tanah Rata were hauled up by police for questioning under Section 504 of the Penal Code for harbouring the intention to insult with the intent to provoke a breach of the peace. The offence carries the sentence of imprisonment for two years and a fine if found guilty. T...

item.title: New coalition, claiming to be non-political, vows to ‘destroy DAP’ over ICERD - Malaysia Today
item.description:
New coalition, claiming to be non-political, vows to ‘destroy DAP’ over ICERD  Malaysia Today

(The Star) – A group of Malay Muslim NGOs has come together to form a “third force alliance” to ensure the DAP “does not erode the rights of the Malays” and “turn Malaysia into a republic”. Gagasan Kuasa 3 (G3) is made up of 53 Malay Muslim NGOs and expects to have 300 Malay Muslim NGOs in the next three months. Its chairman Raggie Jessy, in a press conference here on Wednesday, claimed that the coalition was formed to unite Muslims because there were no politicians standing up for the rights of the Malays. He also claimed that the ratification of the International Convention on the Elimina...

item.title: Kit Siang: Malaysians won’t want ICERD at the price of another May 13 riot - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Kit Siang: Malaysians won’t want ICERD at the price of another May 13 riot  Malaysia Today

(The Star) – Malaysians would not want the International Covenant Against All Forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD) to be ratified at the expense of another May 13 racial riot, says DAP advisor Lim Kit Siang. “No Malaysian would want Malaysia to ratify the ICERD at the price of another May 13 racial riot in the country. “(This is because) there is no doubt that there are irresponsible elements seeking to incite and escalate racial and religious distrust, animosity and hatred to engender the conditions to replicate another May 13 racial riot in Malaysia,” Lim said in a speech at Suzhou, Jia...

item.title: PM: No way to amend Article 153 and ratify ICERD - The Star Online
item.description:
PM: No way to amend Article 153 and ratify ICERD  The Star Online

SERDANG: The Federal Constitution must be amended to ratify the ICERD as Article 153 can be interpreted as giving privileges to the indigenous and be deemed discriminatory, says Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad. “ICERD promotes freedom and less discrimination. Article 153 gives some privileges to the indigenous people, which means some may interpret it as being discriminatory. “If we tried to abolish these privileges, it will go against Article 153. “Article 153 cannot be amended as long as there is no two-thirds majority,” the Prime Minister said when asked why there was a need to amend the Federal...
